    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CoffeeConfirmActivity, PizzaConfirmActivity

    public class Tweeter
extends android.support.v7.app.AppCompatActivity
    This class is the main class for the Tweetbot module. It sets up the Twitter API clients and the OOCSI receiver. This class also contains a method to post a status to Twitter using the account belonging to the credentials, namely @Tweetbot_DBSU10.
    Author:
    Marcin van de Ven, Dianne Vasseur, Manon Blankendaal, Anne Kok

    • Method Detail

      • confirmOrder

        public void confirmOrder(java.lang.String product,
                         java.lang.String username)
        Sends an order confirmation for a product to the Twitter user who placed the order.
        Parameters:
        product - The product that was ordered.
        username - The Twitter user who ordered it. ordered.

      • postStatus

        public void postStatus(java.lang.String newStatus)
        Posts a status to Twitter. Posts a new status (Tweet) on the Tweetbot_DBSU10 account. Tweets cannot exceed 140 characters. The same status can only be posted once every x hours. The exact value of x is unknown (not released by Twitter). Uses ASyncTask to complete function.
        Parameters:
        newStatus - The status to be posted, a string.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the status is not updated properly.

      • setup

        public void setup()
        Sets up Twitter instance, stream listener, and OOCSI receiver. The listener can monitor streaming Twitter data. The OOCSI receiver monitors incoming OOCSI messages on the tweetBot channel.

      • setupStream

        private void setupStream()
        Sets up streaming API client with listener and filter. Listens for tweets containing @Tweetbot_DBSU10. It takes about a minute to establish a connection. Before the message "Receiving status stream" appears in the console, the Twitter stream is not yet being monitored.
